metadata.chief_complaint: 9 month well check, complex social situation

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Hi, good to see you and Jayden! He's gotten so big.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: I know, he's growing like crazy. He's into everything now.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's what nine month olds do! Tell me what new things he's doing.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: He's crawling everywhere, pulling up on furniture, babbling a lot. He says mama and dada. He waves bye-bye.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's all great. Is he picking up small things with his fingers?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Oh yeah, he picks up every little crumb off the floor. I can't keep up.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Perfect. How about eating? Is he taking solid foods well?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: He eats pretty much everything we give him. Purees and some soft table food now. Still breastfeeding a few times a day too.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Wonderful. I want to update my information about your home situation. Who's living in the home with Jayden?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: It's just me and Jayden at my mom's house. My mom and my grandma live there too.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Okay, so three generations. Is Jayden's father involved?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Not really. He sees him sometimes but it's not consistent. We're not together anymore.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I understand. Who watches Jayden when you're at work?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: My grandma mostly. She's retired so she's home during the day. My mom helps when she can but she works too.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: And what do you do for work?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: I work at Target. I do the night shift, four to midnight, so I can be with him during the day. It's exhausting but it works.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's a lot to manage. How are you holding up?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: I'm tired all the time but I'm okay. My family helps a lot. I couldn't do it without them.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'm glad you have support. Are you getting any help with finances? WIC, anything like that?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yeah, we're on WIC. That helps with formula and food. And I just signed up for a childcare subsidy because I'm thinking about putting him in daycare part time.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Why the change?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: My grandma's been having some health issues. Her arthritis is getting worse. I don't want to rely on her too much. And I think daycare might be good for him, you know, other kids to play with.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's a really mature decision. When would that start?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Maybe next month? I'm still figuring out the details.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let me know if you need any paperwork for enrollment. Sometimes they need a physical form.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Oh, that would be helpful. I didn't think about that.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Now let me examine Jayden.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: He's nineteen pounds, eight ounces, and twenty-eight inches. That's 50th percentile for both. Perfect growth.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Eyes look good, ears are clear, heart and lungs sound great. He's got four teeth coming in. Everything looks wonderful.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Does he need shots today?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Yes, he'll get the third dose of hepatitis B and his flu shot since it's flu season. And we'll do a finger poke to check for anemia.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: The finger poke, is that the one where they check his iron?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Exactly. We check all babies at nine months. It's quick.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Okay. When do I bring him back?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: At twelve months for his one year check. Lots of vaccines at that visit too, so prepare yourself.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Thanks for always checking on us both. It means a lot.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Of course. You're doing a great job with him.
